Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Minas L
Reviews.Content: I stayed there through ITB 2012. I shared a room with a friend. The room was really small and the heating wasn't working so good. The internet connection especially the WIFI had a lot of problems... I really loved the breakfast...variety and good quality....I recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Need to catch up”
Reviews.Author: g-drako
Reviews.Content: A great location if you have to be in the west side of the city. However: what it looks nice like a wooden floor, it can be annoying as every time somebody walks you can listen to him/her and ..wake up. Breakfast, at least the one you get by room service, has a lot of space for improvement. Wi Fi not yet, instead 15 m wire to get connected. Then it is a good connection. Avoid the rooms near and mostly under the gym, as they are noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to explore Berlin”
Reviews.Author: kmsc_1
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Easter and were very happy with the choice of Hotel Residenz. The location was convenient for Ku'damm and transport connections from the Zoo, but on a quiet side street. The hotel has beautiful art deco features and our room was the Belvedere right at the top of the building with high ceilings, skylights and interesting views over the roop tops. This was a superior room and worth paying the little bit extra to have a lot of space, a sitting area with chaise longue and large bed under the eaves. The bathroom had a great shower but the extractor fan was quite noisy. Breakfast was not included in the room rate and the hotel offers different options. We had the buffet one day and this had a good selection with very nice breads, fresh fruit, yoghurts, eggs, bacon, cheeses, etc. For the other days we tried several of the bakeries, cafes and bagel shop in the surrounding area and all were great. The hotel staff were friendly and efficient, handling check-in and check-out quickly, making restaurant reservations and giving advice. The internet access was not great with weak wireless signals, but the staff gave suggestions on how to connect. We thoroughly enjoyed the stay and would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Charming building with comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Siem H
Reviews.Content: Good location and comfortable starting point for a citytrip in Berlin. Nice high rooms with good beds. Close to Ku'dam and metro but in a quiet street. Helpful staf and perfect breakfast too.

Reviews.Title: “Returned for Another Stay”
Reviews.Author: rec531
Reviews.Content: Like another reviewer (who must have attended the same conference?), this was my second stay at Residenz Berlin, and my enthusiasm only grows for the place. It truly feels like a home for me in Berlin. Affordable rate. Helpful, attentive, and kind staff. Charming rooms, if small, give the whole hotel a special feeling. Very convenient to Ku'damm, Savigny Platz, and there must be 12 restaurants on Meinekestrasse alone. Free wifi and newspapers. I had booked for five nights, but in the middle of my stay I decided to travel to Prague for two nights and needed to cancel two of my five nights with them. They gave me no problems whatsoever. I look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “My second stay here”
Reviews.Author: Regular_site_user
Reviews.Content: I returned to the Residenz for another conference nearby for 4 nights because of its excellent location, value etc. The room was comfortable and the staff friendly. You get the best deal booking direct and do not have to pre pay if you arrive by 1800. It's also worth downloading their iPhone app which is useful and has a coupon for a large bottle of water in your room and a drink in the bar. There is wifi downstairs and free Internet access via Ethernet cables in the rooms which is fast though using a cable is a pain (you got the codes and cable from reception). Breakfast is good, but if you're in a hurry you can get a decent sandwich or pastry and a coffee for much less in the coffee bar next to Lidl which is just up the street. This is a good option for stocking up on drinks as the mini bar is pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to everything in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Ingvar S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is full of charm. Extremely good location - close to K-dam and good restaurants on the street Meinekengstrasse (two minutes). The different breakfast alternatives confirmed the charm as well as the rooms and the service from the reception. One extra feature was the free internet!

Reviews.Title: “mildly uncomfortable aspects but also some beautiful ones too”
Reviews.Author: vanillabeanspeck
Reviews.Content: This hotel certainly has charm and personality-dark wood, flourishes, rich colors. The room key was attached to a huge brass piece-also charming but heavy to tote around during all-day sightseeing. The hotel was a little run-down and promised wi-fi access didn't work during my entire stay-I had to use the public computer in a small room next to the kitchen that was dark and smelly. Its location is very convenient as it's close to bus lines and major subway stops; it's on a quiet street off the main, bustling, shopping drag of Ku'damm. There are a flight of stairs and elevators, a small restaurant and a seating area with newspapers. Staff were courteous and helpful with directions. I stayed in two rooms. I loved how spacious the first room was, and the tall curtains and windows that opened out into a quiet courtyard. The mattress was old and caved in the middle, causing a backache. The bathroom was small and clean, but the shower head didn't stay put and was difficult to use. The second room was on the topmost floor and featured large skylights above the bed that swung open; I heard birds singing to welcome the dawn. The mattresses were newer and more supportive, but this room heated up quickly on sunny days and filled up with cigarette smoke from nearby rooms. The bathroom was also very clean. Overall, I enjoyed some features but would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: oddao
Reviews.Content: The location is very good - a few hundred meters off Kurfurstendamm. Clean rooms. Internet included in the price. The staff was OK. The breakfast was very simple.Very.

Reviews.Title: “super hotel for super price”
Reviews.Author: juice-trip
Reviews.Content: We had an absolute great stay in the Residenz. The personal was friendly and helpfull, the room not that big but with enough space to feel comfortable. And what do you need more then a good bed and a (extreme) clean bathroom? Okay, a hairdryer maybe, a small bureau, television, a mini-bar? And yes, also those items were also there. Breakfast was excellent. We had a last minute spring-deal, so it was included. Otherwise we would have gone to the Gasthaus Krombach, not more then a two minutes walk from the hotel, where they serve great breakfasts from about 3,90 euro's. The Meineke Strasse itself had a few options for lunch/dinner. Two excellent traditional German places - the Krombach and 'hotelneighbour' Meineke X restaurant, with a big terrace - and the German/French orientated Diekmann, also just a couple of metres away. On the other site of the road is a good Italian (no pizza's), an 'imbiss' and - on the corner - the Hard Rock Cafe. And in the parallel Fasanenstrasse (an absolutely beautiful street) you can enjoy a great breakfast, lunch or just a glass of wine or coffee in the wonderful garden of the Literaturhaus. If the weather allows it. After a day of sightseeing you don't have to go far for your (culinair) entertainment. And who wants to experience the little restaurants and bars on and around the famous Savignyplatz: it's no more then a ten, short 15 minutes walk. We didn't try the hotelrestaurant but heard that it was also quite good. The U-bahn is closeby, so you can go in any direction of Berlin without a problem. And for highlights as the Gedachtniskirche, the fabulous Berlin Zoo and the KaDeWe-Kaufhaus you just need your feet. All are situated within a couple of hunderd metres from the hotel. Next time in Berlin, it will be the Residenz for us again!!! For the atmosphere, the service, the excellent rooms and... the super location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DR75
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful four nights at this hotel. Beautiful, calm and very clean room, comfortable bed with sheets of very good quality and staff competent and discreet . After the day spent out, it was always a pleasure to be back at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Freek62
Reviews.Content: Nice and quiet classic hotel with very friendly staff. Excellent breakfast. Bathroom is small but efficient. Location is in a side street from the Kurfurstendam and very close to the shops, Gedachtniskirche and KaDeWe shopping Mall. Bus nr.109 takes you to and from Tegel airport for only € 2,30 in 30 minutes. Busstop is and the end of the street of the hotel on Kurfurstendam.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: carojm
Reviews.Content: Like a previous reviewer, I stayed here for 3 nights a conference, and felt the hotel was excellent value for €65 a night excluding breakfast. The staff are really friendly and helpful with advice and even travel adapters. I used the fast internet service for which they lent me a cable as mine was too short, and they seem to have wifi in the lobby area. I didn't bother with the gym, instead going for a run in the snow round the nearby Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff went the Extra Mile in a Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rec531
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel because it was close to a conference I attended. It has been my first trip to Berlin, and I felt very much at home at this hotel. The staff was great. I don't know much German, and didn't have time to learn much before I arrived as the trip was not planned too far in advance, but almost all of the staff spoke both English and German and were very friendly. They taught me a lot about the city I would not have otherwise learned, including good restaurant recommendations, museum advice, and accurate instructions on how to use the train. (The U bahn stop is not far away and once I made my initial ride I spent several days hopping all around Berlin.) They also answered my questions about the history of Berlin. In short, their dialogue made me feel more like I was visiting friends rather than staying in a commercial hotel. My room was indeed small, but not cramped. The structure is beautiful with 14 foot ceilings in my room. Bathroom was indeed "gleaming" as another visitor said. Nice courtyard, which is common on this street. There were two breakfast options, and I only tried the full buffet once, and it provided a good range of options even if it was a bit pricey. The single room was a great price at around 80 euros. The internet service was free, though it was structured to charge 12 euros a night (I don't know if they once did charge for it and changed their minds).I went to the fitness center and it was plenty clean; I did not go in to the spa, as the other reviewer noted, but there were three gentlemen in there already who seemed to be having a fine time. I am looking forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Berenique
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right on Kudamm, close to shopping center. Very nice, always very clean rooms, gleaming (shining) bathroom. And all for a reasonable price. Even the rooms with windows on the street are very quiet. Superb restaurant right next to the hotel - Diekmann. Not easy to find parking place

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price, not great either”
Reviews.Author: SoloTraveller053
Reviews.Content: I got a special deal on Lastminute.com for a Top Secret Hotel 4*, however I think the 4* bit was a bit misleading. It was an old fashioned hotel, certainly not a "boutique" hotel but a decent 3* at best. I selected this hotel because of the spa & leisure facilities, but I suspect that i was the only person to have used the gym and sauna in ages as it wasnt particularly clean (pretty dusty) and the sauna was never switched on. This was the main reason why I booked the hotel. The room was decent, nice big comfy bed, the TV was a bit antequated, the bathroom was clean and functional. Good location, around 100 yards from Ubahn station and Kurfurstendamm shopping district, friendly staff. Overall it was worth the money but i expected better from a hotel which promotes itself as a 4* "boutique" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: WardenRon
Reviews.Content: This hotel has 80 rooms - so it is large enough to be open 24 hours, and have a small business centre and helpful English-speaking staff - but manages to maintain a comfortable "boutique" feel in a beautiful Art Nouveau building off Kurfürstendamm. Bedrooms are quiet and quite spacious; and there is a pleasant lounge with free newspapers. Location is very good - just a few minutes walk from the Zoo station, Berlin's West End shops, and U-bahn or bus stops all the main tourist sights of the city, as well as Tegel Airport. Nor is it expensive. Room rates are very competitive; and if you don't want the full breakfast buffet there are cheaper alternatives both in the hotel and nearby. We did not try the restaurant, but it did not seem to be very popular.

Reviews.Title: “great location, older dated hotel”
Reviews.Author: overniteTPE
Reviews.Content: Well located, travel from/to airport bus #109, 30 mins. to Kudam. 2 U-bahn routes #1 and #9, within 2 blocks. On a quiet street, one block from central street --shops/restaurants. Many other more modern hotels in the area. Lobby a little warn and smelly; rooms very small but clean and adequate. Fine/helpful staff. Couldn't find a breakfast option we liked (5+ options offered). Hotel is adequate, but maybe not the best choice for an American.

Reviews.Title: “spirit of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Lidia-Katarzyna
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place for leisure time , for business trips ( relax after busy day.. ), for family with teens.. I have visited this hotel many times... And I will be back here .. For sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: ElisabethvO
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed three wonderful nights at this hotel. The room was spacious and quiet as I had requested, situated on the 5th floor with a sun roof overlooking the courtyard. Very friendly staff and excellent service (except for the guy at night).

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kaleponi
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, just off the Kurfurstendamm (Ku'damm), one of the main shopping streets in Berlin and with plenty of bars and nice restaurants nearby. The hotel itself is on a quiet side street so it is very quiet at night. It has an old fashioned charm, but the rooms are clean and comfortable. There is also a restaurant, where we did not eat, but which looked very nice. We could use the free internet on the computer in the lobby at any hour of day and night. The staff were also very kind and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarlaCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: This is a very beautiful hotel, situated in a quiet street just 1 minute's walk away from the Kurfurstendamm - the main shopping street in Berlin. Rooms and bathrooms are beautiful, everything is spotlessly maintained and the staff are super-friendly and helpful. If you are looking for old-world charm and elegance, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: hey_you_too
Reviews.Content: Fantastic! Great location, great room, great service and great price. Don't expect The Hilton or Four Seasons, but expect clean, comfortable, spacious and friendly. Will absolutely go back next time i'm in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: ORKEMI
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good place to stay. It has old world charm to it -- not some cookie-cutter business hotel. It has a beautiful restaurant and lobby area -- very 19th century. The rooms are also quaint, although a little small. The area was quiet and off the main drags (even though the Hard Rock Cafe is right across the street!). The staff here were all wonderful and very helpful -- spoke great English and were always willing to help out. They gave me a good map of the city to use. Free newspapers in the lobby -- although none were in English. There was a good events newspaper that I used heavily (in English). The hotel is very close to no less than 4 different S-bahn or U-bahn (subway/train) stops. Very easy to base from here and then go any number of directions in the city. It's also very central to many attractions -- such as Charlottenburg, Ka De We, the Zoo, Kurfurstendam, Europe Center. It's not near the new city center though -- but easy access via subways. It was also very easy to get to Tegel airport from here. I walked over to the Zoologischer Garten S-bahn station and caught a 20 minute bus to Tegel for 2.10 Euros -- much cheaper than a taxi (bus runs every 10-15 minutes). It was also easy to get here from the Hauptbahnhof using the S-bahn (straight shot -- no connections). There was one computer with free internet in an office room near the lobby. The room was always open and available. (Nice room too, with a large table and office paper and pens laid out) The bathrooms were fine -- good shower. I didn't have the typical twin bed as a single. I think it was 2 twins put together, but that was better than just one! There were big pillows too! There was no air conditioning, but it wasn't very hot while I was there. Some negatives: 1.) Breakfast was extra and cost 14 Euros. I thought that was a bit pricey for breakfast (especially since that equates to about $19. (It sounds like it was a big breakfast, but I didn't ever go, because of the cost.) 2.) There was no safe in the room, although the staff was very willing to lock up things at the reception 3.) Minibar items were too expensive 4.) Halls can sometimes be a little noisy, because of the old doors closing, etc. 5.) Hotel restaurant looked good, but it was pricey and limited selection (with high-end choices). You weren't going to get a basic Jaegerschnitzel here. The dining room had a beautiful ambience, though. 6.) No coffee/tea making facilities and I didn't see available any in the lobby either. All in all, I liked the hotel, enjoyed my stay there, and would consider staying there again. Like I said, the staff was terrific and did their best to make sure I had a pleasant stay. The room ran me about 70 Euros a night (without breakfast). I guess that isn't too bad a deal in Berlin, but I wouldn't say it was a great deal either. Nice, safe, decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Yet Tasteful”
Reviews.Author: sarahc8208
Reviews.Content: The Golden Tulip was a fairly good value. For 90 Euros a night, we received a non-smoking double bed room overlooking a courtroom. The room was nice and clean, though the bed cover and carpeting looked a bit worn. The employees at the front desk spoke English well, which was a pleasant bonus. The hotel is within walking distance of the zoo and many different restaurants, bars, and shoppes, which is good since parking seemed to be hard to come by. Considering this was a spur-of-the-moment trip and was put together without much research, I was pleased with the Golden Tulip and would recommend it to someone looking for a place to stay in Berlin and who doesn't mind not having many frills.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsmunners
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful Hotel. All the staff were freindly and very helpful, rooms were very clean, and the breakfast was wonderful. A nice little touch was a christmas gift left on the handle of our door on our first morning, which I thought was very sweet. The location was fantastic and close to all the public transport, of which we used all the time ot get to all the major sites. I reccomend travellers to try the public transport as it is first class and very easy and cheap to use, we used a taxi from the airport as we did not know how to get to the hotel by train, which cost us 31 euros but going back to the airport we used the train which cost us 6 euros each. All in all a fantastic stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Old Granduer”
Reviews.Author: Billgorwel
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 day stay in Berlin. Hotel is in excellent location, just off the Kurfustendam, (main shopping street in Berlin) within walking distance of Zoological Gardens Station (rail and bus). A couple of good bars, with good menus, within easy walking distance of the hotel. Hotel has all the contempory amenities that help your stay, this does not detract from the era of hotel. Room was clean, tidy and comfortable, with high ceilings and windows looking onto inner court. Staff were friendly and helpful. The only complaints would be that the room we stayed in the shower/toilet area was a bit on the small side for a large person and no coffee/tea making facilities available.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: karenhutcheson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. The ornate decor of the intererior is amazing. The staff were very friendly, albeit one member of staff who yawned, and looked liked we had bothered her, when we returned one evening and requested drinks from the bar! The rooms were great. Plainly decorated rooms but lovely 12' high ceilings. The bathroom was on the small side but great power shower. Too powerful actually, ended up with a lot of water on the floor! Breakfast was plentiful and varied. The location was superb. Lots of restaurants, bars, - Hard Rock Cafe just across the road - designer shops at the end of the road. Amongst other things, we went to the Tiergarten Zoo which was about 10 minute walk away and had a very pleasant day out. Weather was amazing too! We got a taxi from Shoenfeld Airport and it cost 32 euros. We used taxis a couple of times and they were reasonably priced. Ate at an Indian called Kashmir Palace which was quite near hotel, wouldn't recommend it, out of 4 adults not one of us had a good meal. Went to a Turkish in Kreutzberg, taxi cost 13 euros, called Delphn, I think, well worth the taxi ride. Had a typical German meal in a restaurant just along the street, it too was excellent, but can't rememer what it was called! Loads of things to do. Did the City Tour bus but couldn't really hear all the info from the tour guide due to traffic, would therefore recommend a tour where you get earphones provided. All in all, great hotel in a great location in a great City. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and efficiency in central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Spiral2
Reviews.Content: Our family of four, (parents and teenagers) stayed at the Golden Tulip Residenz Berlin for three nights at the end of August 2006. From the moment we arrived until we left we found this hotel to be excellent. The staff all spoke excellent English and they were very helpful and efficient in dealing with all our requests. The position of the hotel is excellent on a quiet street off Kurfurstendamn yet within a few minutes walk of the Zoo and of Wittenbergplatz. There are plenty of clothes and shoe stores here and also many restaurants. The U-Bahn is easily accessible although at present there is a lot of disruption on the line into the Mitte area. All three of the rooms we had in the hotel were very plain in décor but had every thing we needed and in addition two had small balconies over the courtyard which always pleases me. Bathrooms were fine with excellent power showers – although the curtains were inclined to block the water outlets. The beds were a little on the firm side for my taste but were clean as was the rest of the hotel. However the best point about the hotel (other than the staff) was the really excellent breakfast. This was extensive, with bacon, sausage and scrambled eggs available in addition to a large variety of cereals, fresh fruit and dried fruit. Also there was a large selection of rolls, toast and smoked and cold meats and cheese including smoked salmon. This is normally, I believe, about 13 Euros each but we got it as a bed and breakfast deal - an excellent bargain. If we visit Berlin again we will certainly use this hotel and recomend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from our first visit to Berlin which is a phenomenal city, and I'm delighted we chose to stay at the Residenz. We got it for about £50 a night, including breakfast which shows the internet is worth searching around! The hotel is centrally located, in fact it's perfect. You're about 500m from the U-Bahn, and the Ku'damm is a great shopping area. There are also some lovely restaurants nearby. The room was decent enough, high ceilings and doors, and all very clean. My one beef was that the double bed was two beds pushed together and the pillows were fairly uncomfortable. The staff were incredibly pleasant and helpful, and our child was spoilt rotten by them at breakfast! Incidentally, the breakfast was excellent too! I'll stay here again - great value, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Taste of old Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Itaiphile
Reviews.Content: Considering the price, this hotel is a real find. Located on a quiet street off the Kurfurstendamm, it has lots of charming Art Nouveau touches from when it was built at the turn of the century -- overall, a nice taste of old Berlin. The rooms (mine was 90 euros a night) are well furnished and decently sized, with high ceilings and tall windows, so that even if your room faces the courtyard you get lots of sunshine. I found the staff very pleasant and helpful, the breakfasts delicious, the location excellent (in fact Meinekestrasse has several good restaurants, especially the Italian "Arlecchino" down the block). I would certainly recommend staying here, and I intend to stay here again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: kaz1957
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, excellent location just off the main shopping street the Kudam. Trains above and below ground very easy to reach and very cheap! Only downside to Hotel was the staff they didnt really understand English very well at all, so not easy to communicate. Lovely buffet breakfast with everything you can think of to eat and drink excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everyone has their own criteria for a great hotel, and location is one of my most important elements. Meineke Strasse, just off the Ku'dam is about as good as it gets. One couple, to whom I recommended this hotel, said, "You actually don't ever have to leave the block on which this hotel is located" And that is true; quiet, yet full of different restaurants and shops, the street also features a coffee shop with computers where you can log in to check e-mail. It is a v short walk to the u-bahn, and there must be 10 bus routes which stop on the corner. Now, the hotel could use a makeover, no doubt about it, but you get what you pay for, and the basics were just fine for me. I would, indeed, stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Residenz”
Reviews.Author: pinkelvis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residenz during a Berlin-weekend in December 2003. The hotel is located near Kurfürstendamm. However, this aeria isn't the city's hot spot anymore. Our room facing the courtyard was very quiet but very cramped and dark, too. The furniture was really old-fashioned and the fixed carped hiding a parquet floor was long 20 or 30 years old and disgusting. The bath curtain was so unluckily fixed that the small bath room was overwhelmed every morning. The "fitness room" consists of 3 cardio-equipment and nothing more and they aren't able to support you with goggles for the solarium. Our room rate didn't include breakfast and 13,- extra pP per day seemed really inadequate so that we decided to have our breakfast outside the hotel. The staff at the reception was shortspoken, if not to say unfriendly. The Residenz Berlin is definitely no four-star and not worth the price postet in our room ( 153,-). We payed 80,- for the room due to online reservation over wotif website and in our opinion it's the upper limit you should spend for it!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Residenz Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Meinekestrasse 9, 10719 Berlin, Germany
